page.title: 20SOCIAL PROBLEMS
page.content: THE FOLLOWING OBSERVATIONS HAVE BEEN WRITTEN BY TEENAGERS. GALASHIELS IS A RELATIVELY SMALL TOWN BOASTING SOME TWELVE THOUSAND INHABITANTS BUT, OWING TO ITS STATUS AS SOCIAL CENTRE OF THE BORDERS,IT ENJOYS A CONSTANT FLOW OF VISITORS BOTH FROM SURROUNDING AREAS AND FURTHER AFIELD,AND DURING THE SUMMER IS A HUB OF ACTIVITY. HOWEVER BENEATH THE IDYLLIC VENEER LURKS THE SEAMIER SIDE OF LIFE COMMON TO MANY LARGER TOWNS.DRUG AND SOLVENT ABUSE,ALCHOHOLISM AND VANDALISM,ARE GROWING PROBLEMS.LICENCED CLUBS AND PUBLIC HOUSES ADMITTING PEOPLE UNDER THE AGE OF EIGHTEEN ENCOURAGES THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN ILLEGAL ACTIVITIES, ADDING TO TO THESE SOCIAL PROBLEMS.
